inn1.comm: slung down on a length outside off, Amla raising his arms high to leave. There seems to be decent bounce and carry off the grassy surface
pushed slightly fuller and wider by Bollinger, and Amla quietly has another look
smell that! Bollinger zips one past Amla's beard with a grunt. The umpire calls one for the over as the Australia fans in the ground cheer their approval. Ah, in fact he's called that wide! Bit harsh
Bollinger continues to plug away outside off, Amla leaving alone once more
Amla's not going to keep leaving them outside off! He rides the bounce on this rising delivery and slaps a cut behind square
that's the length! Bollinger draws Amla forward and the ball spits off the surface, hitting the splice and flying through gully
a hint of shape in through the air at Smith, who shuffles into a defensive push
shot! Caressed through cover by Amla, who eased forward into a checked drive with superb balance and timing

and again. This shot doesn't quite have the finesse of the last one, but Amla strokes it well enough to find the boundary again. Mitchell Johnson was the fielder who set off after it, sliding gingerly near the rope but unable to stop it
a touch shorter from Cummins, outside off, and Amla leaves alone
the cut, this time, from Amla! It was hit really hard, beating a leaping Ponting at backward point
Amla is taking Cummins apart here, in clinical fashion. This was overpitched on the pads and Amla rolled his wrists over the ball with serpentine grace to reach the midwicket boundary
a good delivery from the young bowler to end the over, seaming one in sharply to strike Amla on the thigh
pulled in the air over midwicket ... but in unconvincing fashion. Still, he's hit it well enough to beat the fielder in the circle
much fuler from Bollinger, outside off, and Smith props half forward to defend to point
tight stuff from Bollinger, hitting just the right length outside off to keep Smith defending
beaten outside off! Bollinger seamed this one off the surface to beat Smith's poking outside edge
worked into the leg side, and Smith shouts a loud "no!" as the fielder runs in
beaten again! Great lines from Bollinger outside off. Smith played inside the line, and did well not to push out at the ball
and now Amla is beaten on the inside edge! A Kemar Roach-style delivery that was angled in and then went further off the seam to nip between the batsman's driving bat and his off stump
Amla responds to a good length delivery on off stump with a solid defensive push
a touch straight from Cummins, but Amla's whip to leg is stopped at midwicket
chopped down to wide third man, just the single
slanted across the burly left-hander, who leaves well alone
Cummins shoots another one across Smith's bows, but he won't be tempted into a shot and raises his arms high to leave
Bollinger is very full on off stump, Amla digging it out back to the bowler
a fiery delivery! A nasty bouncer rises up and strikes Amla on the chest, Bollinger following through all the way down the track to give the batsman a good glare
Bollinger is a little on the short side again, but this time Amla hops to ride the bounce and tucks to leg
this is probing stuff from Bollinger, who swings this one in through the air towards middle stump to hurry Amla's nudge to leg
solid defence from Amla to a full length delivery on off stump
and a firm backfoot defensive push ends the over
crunched defensively towards mid off
a tad too straight from Cummins, but he's not overly punished as Smith's leg glance is stopped at square leg
ah, but he won't miss out twice in a row! Cummins might have been aiming for the yorker here, but he's missed his mark and the ball was sent racing to the long leg boundary with a firm flick
glanced down to short fine leg for a single. In fact, that's hit the thigh pad rather than the bat
worked into the leg side with poise and unbalance, but without the right placement to beat the field
driven firmly at the short extra cover fielder, who stops it on the bounce
Smith was in a bit of trouble here, against a well-directed bouncer. Smith was rushed by the ball, flinching and fending it down behind square
shot! Amla is in pretty good nick. This is slapped on the up through extra cover, the ball pinging right out of the middle of the bat
this wasn't the orthodox slower ball, but it was definitely went down a good 10kph slower than usual, swinging in to Amla
and he follows that up with a brutish bouncer! That was pretty quick, and fizzed past Amla's slightly wild hook in a flash
Amla is foward this time, and drives to mid off without a great deal of timing. Toe-ended it
wow, this must have stung the hands of the fielder. Amla leaned forward to smash a drive square of the wicket, but straight to the man at cover point. He hit it really hard
a very medium-paced start from Watto, Smith stepping forward to defend to leg
punched to cover off the front foot
a leg stump half-volley is muscled to the midwicket boundary! Plenty of bottom hand in the stroke. Plenty of power too
nudged into the leg side again, just the one this time
Amla comes half forward to defend a good length delivery
a short, rising delivery outside off is chopped down to third man for a single to end a decent first over from Watto
Amla is confident enough to carry on driving on the whip, but he can't beat the field with this shot
squirted off the inside half of the bat to square leg. Great length from Bollinger
Amla flashes outside off! There was certainly width on offer, but Amla's flashing blade was beaten by some extra bounce
great touch! There were cries of "catch it!" when Amla played this stroke, but it was nowhere near any of the fielders, racing square on the off side
Dougie doesn't like to be driven, and pulls his length back to have Amla hopping in defence
a slashed cut bounces down to third man
nice and full from Watson, wobbling around on off stump, and Amla defends to cover
floated up very full on off stump again. This time Amla drove hard back down the track, Watto palming the ball back towards the non-striker's stumps
Smith shuflles right across to the off side to glance this to the left of the man at short fine leg
this time Smith stays still, defending from the crease
beaten on the outside edge! Great line from Watson, and the delivery is greeted by several yelps of "bowled Watto!" from behind the wicket with a distinct Aussie twang
and Smith is solid ... in defence to end the over
back of a length and Amla works it into midwicket
some swing for Johnson but he also offers width which Smith latches onto with a strong square drive which third man runs around to cut off
on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
too straight this and it's flicked out to deep square
jumps back in the crease and plays a shortish delivery to the leg side
full outside off, driven with power square of the wicket but straight to Ponting at point
full outside off, driven without much timing to the leg side
whips this from off stump down to leg side with that strong bottom hand
now Amla flicks a straight delivery through square leg
close! Smith tries to launch this down the ground but he miscues the drive and it falls short of mid-off
down the leg side and an easy call
back at off stump and again Smith targets the leg side where midwicket makes a good save
full on off stump, defended to cover
well bowled, beats Smith's inside edge as he tries to play to the leg side and is taken high on the pads
dragged down short, Smith connects well with his pull but deep square leg cuts it off
slashes off the back foot and gets a thick outside edge down to third man but it was fairly well controlled
driven firmly to mid off

nearly! Hussey couldn't catch the cat and he didn't quite catch this either. It was another miscued drive from Smith as he tries to clear mid-on and Hussey dives forward but can't quite get his hands under the catch
worked down to long leg
round the wicket, defended into the off side
great catch! This time Hussey makes it, and it's a blinder. Smith plays the sweep and doesn't keep the ball down. It skims towards deep midwicket where Hussey races in then dives forward
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
driven to the left of mid-off and there's some frustration that Kallis is allowed a fairly comfortable run to start with
very full and driven back to the bowler
well bowled, a quicker ball which takes an inside edge into the pad
full outside off and played firmly into the covers
stays full and Kallis plays another textbook drive into the off side
drags the length back and it's defended from the crease
tight over building up as Kallis punches off the back foot and finds cover
played off the back foot into the off side...can Johnson finish the over well?
bang! Amla's taken a blow. Excellent bouncer from Johnson which shapes back at Amla and strikes him on the helmet as he tries to sway out of the line.
nice batting, dropped with very soft hands into the off side
driven down the ground to long off
aggression from Kallis as he comes down the pitch then drives wide of mid-on. It was at catchable height but expertly placed
some turn there for Doherty and Kallis plays square into the off side
that's a more convincing blow, further good footwork from Kallis and this time he ensures he clears the infield with a mighty shot over long on
now he pushes into an off-side gap, very smart batting from Kallis
short on leg stump, Kallis pulls it off the hip and it isn't far from carrying to short fine-leg while Kallis has to motor to complete the single
full outside off and driven out to the sweeper
short of a length at the body, Kallis comes inside the line and flicks towards fine leg
full on leg stump and worked to mid-on
full and fairly wide of off stump but this Amla doesn't quite time his drive
closer to off stump this time and Amla gets a thick inside half of the bat down to mid-on
starts full on off stump and it's driven to mid-on
touch too straight and it allows Kallis to work it down to long leg
waits on the back foot and works a slower ball into midwicket
plays this late with soft hands into the vacant slip area
onto the front foot and sweetly driven out to deep cover
another drive into the deep to end the over
comes half forward and defends with an open face to backward point
opens the face again and this time beats a diving Ponting to get a single down to third man
jumps onto the back foot and works it through the leg side
flicks a straight delivery to midwicket
ooh, Kallis goes for an expansive drive but the ball flies off the inside edge towards square leg...wasn't a million miles from the stumps
pushed wider outside off stump, Amla leaves perhaps expecting a wide but it's within the margins
bit of pain for Kallis, there's extra bounce from Watson and it takes the fingers on the bottom hands as Kallis defends
slower ball, although not by a huge amount, and it's tucked through square leg
he's getting some grip off the surface and Amla works it backward of square on the leg side
fuller and outside off, Kallis frees his arms into a drive and a slightly open face sends it down to third man
nearly drags this into the stumps as he plays away from his body and another delivery that grips on the surface
opens the face and plays it late down to third man
a very full ball is squirted out through cover point and out to the sweeper

a shy, a direct hit, and a run off the deflection! Amla had punched the ball to Warner at cover and Kallis backed up quite far. Amla sent him back as the throw came in, then called him through for the single after the ball had ricocheted off the stumps. This might actually be quite close ... nope, he was home in good time
firmly defended to cover point off the front foot
Kallis is forward again, this time drilling a drive at mid off
you can't get forward to that! Cummins gets Kallis ducking with a quick bouncer. Ah, but it's a bit too short, and is called wide
nice batting from Kallis, a drop-and-run single taken after the ball is dabbed into the off side
Amla sends a leg-stump delivery out to the deep midwicket sweeper with a whipped glance off the pads
Amla skips down the track to get to the pitch and collects a single to long on
quick and flat through the air, Kallis defends
pushed to cover point off the back foot
Doherty held this one back a bit, and got some purchase off the surface. Kallis waits for the spin and chops to gully
too short from the left-arm spinner, and Kallis hammers a cut out into the deep
flicked off the pads through square leg for one
angling in to the body, and Amla nudges off the hip for a single to fine leg
Kallis sets himself to drive, but doesn't time the shot into the covers
sliced over point! Kallis seemed to be aiming to chip this over cover, driving on the up, but was too soon into the stroke and slashed across it a bit. Still, four runs
chopped down to third man for a rather more undramatic single
the bouncer from Cummins! It's a reasonably good one, but Amla is untroubled as he sways out of the way
beaten on the drive! Cummins sent one down really full and quite wide, and Amla tried to drive it square but couldn't put bat to ball
floated down full on off stump from round the wicket, Kallis driving back to the bowler
eased down to long on for an ambled single
Amla uses his feet but can't quite get to it and defends to point
Amla greets a short, wide delivery with a cut, but the shot is stopped by a diving Warner at point
turn and bounce! Doherty gave this one a good rip and spun it past Kallis's outside edge
Kallis gets well forward this time to defend another flighted delivery to extra cover
tapped off the toes through square leg, and that's fifty for Hashim Amla
flicked into the leg side, where it's stopped by midwicket
drilled down to long off, good shot for one run
inside edged onto the thigh! Amla was looking to work this to leg, and just played outside the line. The ball bounced off the thigh and past Haddin
nudged into the leg side for a single
lifted into the stands at deep midwicket! Much too short from Clarke, and Kallis rocked back to clobber a pull over the boundary
was this off the pad? Doherty speared down the leg side and the ball hit something before rolling to short fine leg
tapped defensively to cover
placed to cover once again, this time there's a single to be had
Amla hangs back to a short-ish delivery and forces it out to deep cover off the back foot
dropped by Haddin! It was a really tough chance though, Kallis got a huge edge on it and the ball deviated sharply. That would've been an absolute blinder if he'd even got a glove on it

dabbed to short third man ... and this could well be run out! Amla had to hurry as the throw was fired in. They're going to have another look at this. The return from the fielder was bang on target, and Amla is short of his ground! Cummins was the fielder. He's got quite an arm
the ball spits off a length to strike the splice! Kallis removed the bottom hand from the bat very gingerly as he tapped it down to gully
Cummins is full at Duminy, who flicks to leg without a great deal of foot movement
slanted across the left-hander, who leaves well alone
fuller from Cummins, but the line is the same and this time Duminy leaves off the front foot
Duminy is off the mark with a little dink down the ground, mid off running round to cut it off
defended into the covers with a solid crunch
aggression from Duminy! He charges out at Doherty and drills the ball back at the bowler
this time the batsman hangs back and nudges one just behind point for a single
good line from Doherty, landing the ball on middle stump from around the wickets to draw Kallis's defence
defended with the spin towards point
Kallis gets forward to drive square, but once again hits the point fielder
this time he gets it past him! A bad end to what was a decent over from Doherty. He offered up a long hop outside off that Kallis cut firmly to the cover boundary, beating a diving Hussey out there
Duminy gets a tip-and-run single to cover
angled in towards the batsman's midriff, but it's glanced to fine leg with minimum fuss
nice shot from Duminy, who sends the ball bouncing out to deep cover with a loose-wristed drive
Cummins targets middle stump with a full delivery, Kallis tapping to midwicket
good length from Cummins, and great wheels too. Kallis was neither forward or back as he defended this pacy delivery
chopped down to gully, and the call for a single from Duminy is immediate
floated down on middle, Kallis getting well forward to push it back to the bowler
driven back to the bowler once again
slammed out to deep cover off the front foot
nicely flighted from Doherty, and Duminy lunges forward in defence
edged! But it pops up off Haddin's gloves and falls short of gully
was there a touch on this as well? Kallis propped forward but the ball ripped past him and bounced out of Haddin's gloves again. Not sure if he got a touch on it or not. Yep, HotSpot confirms it
whipped off the pads and out to long leg
Kallis goes to fifty with a drop-and-run single to point. His 13th against Australia, and his 84th overall
a wild bouncer shoots miles over Duminy's head and down the leg side too. A clear wide
off the outer half of the bat, but controlled down to third man
driven on the up through cover point, threading the fielders inside the circle - but there's a man out in the deep
fired down the leg side, the ball kisses the pad on the way through and is well stopped by a diving Haddin
driven hard off the front foot, but straight to the cover fielder
pushed into the off side
not quite so full this time, Kallis can't find a gap in the off side
he's squared up by a hint of turn but is good enough to adjust with soft hands and drop the ball towards short third man
worked out to midwicket
uses his feet and takes this from outside off but again can't beat midwicket
touch shorter, Duminy goes onto the back foot and plays square to point
starts with a big appeal for lbw and they go for a review after it's given not out. Was full and appeared to be trapped by Kallis between bat and pad and HotSpot shows that it was inside edge first
worked from middle stump down to mid-on
angled towards leg stump and tucked to square leg
beaten outside off as he tries to guide it down to third man
full outside off, driven through the off side to the sweeper
moves right across the crease outside off then drives down to long off
he's bowled very well and this again turns to take the outside edge towards short third man but Kallis played with soft hands
round the wicket, Duminy goes across his stumps the tucks the ball round the corner to short fine leg
slightly quicker and Kallis defends to the off side

gone! Reward for Doherty and Australia. Kallis tries to break the shackles with a sweep and, like Smith, gets a top edge which, unlike Smith, goes high in the air before being well taken by Marsh inches from the deep square boundary
uses his feet then drives down to long off
onto the back foot and works a straight ball wide of midwicket
beats the outside first ball as du Plessis feels for quite a wide delivery
walks towards the bowler then tucks this from off stump into the leg side
poor delivery, fired down the leg side and Haddin can't reach it despite a dive while fine leg can't get round either
back at off stump, full length and it's driven to mid-on
sends down a bouncer but it's off line and pass Duminy outside leg stump. It's an excellent take from Haddin who had to dive again
full outside off, driven with a bit of a flourish through the off side
misfield at mid-on as du Plessis plays a sweet on-drive. Hussey didn't get the kindest bounce as he dived across
on off stump, defended to the off side
nearly a run out! Initially Johnson got away with a leg-stump delivery that was flicked straight to short fine-leg. Duminy then wanted a single but was sent back and a direct hit would have had him
dragged down short on off stump but Duminy doesn't connect cleanly as his pull goes to mid-on
flicked along the ground wide of mid-on
worked out through square leg
full outside off, hint of swing, Duminy comes onto the front foot and pushes back to the bowler
pushed into the leg side, another good over from Johnson
back of a length at Duminy who can't get it away
he misses out on some width now as the ball scoots over his top edge as he tries to cut
this one is a touch fuller and Duminy opens the face to find third man
full on off stump and driven straight to cover
good stuff from Bollinger, banged in back of a length and it nips back at du Plessis, beating the inside edge and taking the pad through to Haddin
another dot racked up as du Plessis has an unconvincing flash outside off stump and is beaten
on off stump and pushed into the covers
comes across the crease but can only flick the delivery straight to midwicket
another shot finds a fielder as du Plessis drives sweetly to mid-off
touch shorter and du Plessis waits a fraction longer before opening the face to send the ball to third man
no timing from Duminy as he drives a full delivery towards mid-on
worked off middle stump but it's only a single into midwicket
movement for Bollinger as this swings into Duminy on a full length and it's pushed to mid-on
worked from off side into the leg side and the bowler fields
tight line on off stump, plays with soft hands and dabs to third man
hint of width outside off stump but again it only costs a single as Duminy runs it through backward point to third man
dropped behind square on the off side
beaten! Can't taken advantage of a fairly wide delivery as he plays a half-hearted cut
full on middle, cramps du Plessis for room and all he can do is defend to the off side
finally, South Africa find the boundary. du Plessis uses his feet then slots a drive between cover and mid-off
back-to-back, how often that happens, as Johnson drifts onto leg stump and du Plessis pulled it away fine
driven square through the off side
angling towards the pads and it's worked square to the leg side
good delivery, extra pace on that and it beats the outside edge as du Plessis tries to guide it to third man
Cummins keeps it full, and Duminy's drive is stopped at extra cover
Duminy sends a length delivery down to third man with a deft little late dab
slower ball from Cummins, and though it's not quite picked by du Plessis he plays it well enough to squeeze the ball down to third man
Duminy presents the full face of the bat in a drive out to long off
du Plessis is almost knocked off his feet! Cummins speared down a sharp yorker that the batsman dug it just in time, losing his footing in the process
chipped in the air! But past Cummins' outstretched left hand and down to long off
extra bounce for Watson! He held this delivery cross-seam and got it to spit off the surface, rapping du Plessis on the gloves
shot! Duminy drives well square of the wicket, but a diving, sliding Shaun Marsh saves two on the boundary
pitched right up to the bat on off stump, and it's dug out down to long off
a diving stop from Warner! It looked as though du Plessis would get an easy single to long off, but Warner sprinted across from cover and leapt to stop it
du Plessis slashes outside off, and the outside edge bounces down to third man
eased down to long off once more, and a single ends the over
Cummins starts with a slow offcutter, which Duminy waits for and dabs behind point
superb yorker from the young bowler, but du Plessis jams the bat down to keep it out

du Plessis falls to an extremely slow slower ball! He was looking to play a shot into the off side but by the time the ball got to him his bat had swung round and instead he lifted it out straight to the man at deep square
past the outside edge! Duminy was forward and into a drive but was beaten by the angle and a hint of seam movement
chopped down to third man for one
this is great bowling from Cummins. He's fired down another yorker right on the toes, and all Miller can do is dig it out into the leg side
floated down on middle and off, and Duminy drives back to the bowler. He's really struggled to get going in this knock
cut down to third man, and they take an ambled single
full and straight from Watson, and Miller nudges gently to leg
was there any bat on this? Miller shuffled down the track as Watson fired one down the leg side, and the ball ended up down at fine leg. Nope, leg byes signals the umpire
a low full toss is whipped out to deep midwicket
another dipping full toss on the toes from Watson, and Miller follows Duminy in flicking out into the deep
sharp seam movement for Bollinger! He nips one in off the wicket to strike Miller on the thigh
a full, swinging delivery is driven and then intercepted by the man at cover
Duminy finds the boundary! There was width on offer, but he didn't try to hit it too hard, placing it behind point and well enough to beat third man
tapped through cover point for a single. The 100th of the innings, the TV commentator informs us
Miller swipes across the line at a length delivery, and misses completely. It was the sort of length a batsman might be hoping for at this stage of the innings, but he couldn't capitalise
clipped off the pad. The man at midwicket inside the circle stops the shot, but can't prevent the single
Watson continues his good work with another full, straight delivery that is driven back at him
Miller swings his bat like a battle-axe at a low full toss, but he can't get past Warner at midwicket
another play-and-miss from Miller, who backs away to give himself room but can't connect with the forcing stroke aimed at cover
and again! There must still be something in this track for the quicks. And for Watto. Miller tried to slap it to cover again, but didn't get close
another dot! This is fantastic death bowling. Or is it just bad batting? Miller digs a low full toss out back to the bowler
finally, a run - but it's just the single, Miller flicking out to deep midwicket. And that takes South Africa to 200
Miller misses the pull to a seaming delivery, but they take a single off the thigh
smeared out to deep square, Duminy swinging right across the line at a length delivery. It was almost a sweep
Miller heaves across the line now, the ball rolling quickly down to long on

is that a catch? Bollinger and Haddin both think so. Duminy had set himself for another swipe to leg, but Bollinger followed him and the ball flicked the hip before being pouched by a diving Haddin. The umpire doesn't think there was any glove on it, and they've got no reviews left
and now Duminy walks across his stumps, hoping to paddle this to fine leg, but can't lay bat on ball
speared down the leg side, a clear wide
chopped down to short third man for one. Another good over for Australia
he strikes straight away, and a frustrated Duminy is caught close to the boundary at midwicket! He got a good connection on the slog to leg, but couldn't hit it far enough to get it over Ponting
that might've been two in two! Miller attempted to mow a short ball over midwicket, but timed the stroke really badly and it dropped well short of the fielder
Boucher is off the mark straight away with a slightly manic tip-and-run single to point
Miller swings at the yorker and an inside edge rolls to short fine leg
another dot ball, South Africa are really struggling to get them away at the death
a short delivery is pulled hard but straight to the man out at deep square
smacked hard out into the leg side ... but straight to the fielder once again
Watson is on target with the yorker, but Miller has a go at it anyway and gets two to deep midwicket
a low, dipping full toss takes the inside edge of the bat and bounces off Miller's shoe ... No chance of a single
a drive, on the up, is cracked straight to cover, but they hustle a single all the same. It would've been very close if Ponting had hit with the shy

Boucher finds the boundary! A good, improvised shot from him. He got right across to the off side and paddled it up and over Haddin. There wasn't much pace on the ball, but there was enough for a boundary
a full ball is dug out into the covers, and they take a single
Johnson slants one quite wide across Boucher, who flails and misses ... That was tight, but not a wide. Good call from the umpire
Boucher holes out to long off! He sliced right across the ball, and presented an easy catch to Warner
Miller cracks a cut hard through point ... but straight to the fielder on the boundary!
Botha was hoping to target fine leg with this shot, but missed the paddle and toe-ended it into the off side. The umpire signals leg byes, but there was bat on that
a pretty decent yorker is dug out through square leg, just the single
a flat-batted pull rolls out into the deep, and again it's just the single

inn2.comm: starts outside off stump and Watson guides it to backward point
dropped in short, Watson responds with a pull that doesn't come out of the middle but falls safely in front of deep square leg
good line, on off stump and Watson jumps into a defensive shot
back of a length, pushed across Watson who punches off the back foot to cover
too much width this time and Watson throws his full power behind a cut which whistles to the boundary although it was in the air at a catchable height
a beauty! Great response from Tsotsobe who bends his back and gets some extra lift from back of a length. The ball climbs past Watson's outside edge as he tries to pull the bat inside the line
starts on leg stump but there's a hint of swing, Warner tucks it into the square-leg area
swings again but this started outside leg stump and just went further

dropped Steyn sticks out a right hand in his follow through but can't hold on. It was back of a length, stopped a little on the pitch and Warner pushed at it to send the ball looping down the pitch but it was quite some distance from Steyn and would have been a super catch
played into the leg side
outside off and left alone
full on off stump, hint of shape into Warner who punches to mid-off
drifting towards leg stump again and it's worked backward of square on the leg side then the opening pair are quick between the wickets
excellent fielding at backward point by Duminy, saves a boundary, as Watson cuts hard after being offered some width
goes full this time, at the stumps, searching for some swing and it's dug out back to the bowler
back outside off stump, Watson comes into the front foot and defends
short ball and Watson dispatches it through midwicket with a well-timed pull...bit of a waste from Tsotsobe
the bowler gets back to a full length and Watson plays to the off side
good length on off stump, that's where he wants to stay, and it's defended to cover
good line, on off stump with a hint of shaping back into the batsman who defends
fuller outside off, Warner punches it back to Steyn who palms it towards mid-off
pushed wider outside off stump and left alone
slower ball outside off, no shot offered by Warner and it bounces well in front of Mark Boucher
gets on the pads and it bobbles towards square leg
nice shape to Watson and it finds the outside edge but it was played with soft hands and goes safely wide of the slips to third man
full on off stump and defended to the off side
he tries to cut loose but only clubs this full delivery straight to mid-on
squared up a touch this time, the ball straightens from around middle stump and takes a thick outside edge to backward point
power and placement this time from Watson, was full outside off stump and he played forward with a thumping straight drive
that's even better, he goes through mid-on this time with a lovely shot. The perfect on drive and Watson holds his pose at the end
full and wide outside off, Watson drives through cover but it's the longer part of the ground so it doesn't quite reach the boundary
full on off stump, finds the inside edge with some swing and the ball thuds into the pads
fuller on off stump and Warner responds with a crisp drive to mid-off
drives again and finds the gap between mid-off and cover but it's not perfectly timed so it's easily cut off
that's a good spot for Steyn, full on middle and off with a hint of out swing and Watson defends
outside off and left alone as it swings nicely through to Boucher
full on off stump, driven with an open face through backward point down to third man
he's greeted by a strong drive from Watson who is looking threatening. It was full and a touch wider but Amla made a good chase from mid-off to save a run
this takes a bottom edge and bounces through to the keeper
push and run from Warner as he plays towards mid-off and sets off straight away
outside off stump, Watson opens the face to find the gap wide of the slips
no respect there from Warner as he lofts a full delivery straight back over the bowler's end although it doesn't quite have the legs to go for six
gone! Morkel hits back. Angled across outside off, Warner was in two minds and in the end the ball runs off the toe end as he tries to leave
onto the front foot, again played with an open face to find third man
full on middle and off, Ponting plays to midwicket
too straight this time and it allows Ponting to flick it off the pads down to long leg
what a ripper! Full, just outside off stump, and shaping away from Ponting who is beaten by late swing. Tough to play them
tight on off stump, defended back to the bowler
maybe trying for the magic ball, Steyn drifts onto leg stump which allows Ponting a comfortable flick through midwicket

big appeal for lbw, and he's given! But Watson reviews it straight away. It's a legal delivery, now is is bat first? HotSpot shows a mark, but did it come before it hit the pad? Oh, yes, it's a clear edge into the pad. This will be overturned. That is why DRS works.
back of a length, take the edge past the slips and also beats third man... the bowler isn't impressed
working up a head of steam, here, but loses his line down the leg side
fetch that! Full on off stump and Watson dispatches it straight down the ground through mid-on with dismissive ease. This isn't a medium-pacer bowling
wrong line again, angled down the leg side and takes the pad then beats a diving Boucher
my goodness, what a blow. Was full again and Watson lofted it high over mid-off and it cleared the boundary rope by about a foot
now he hangs back, this is a touch shorter (hardly surprising) and he angles it to third man
good length on off stump, shape away from Watson who plays towards backward point
extra bounce for Steyn from back of a length and it climbs past Watson's top edge as he's taken by surprise
fuller on off stump, Watson defends square into the off side...he's still keen to try and get forward
stays on the back foot this time and opens the face to send the ball to third man
full outside off, swings away and is left alone
he comes forward to a full delivery and drives to cover
looped down just outside off, Watson defends watchfully
misdirected down the leg side, and that's a clear wide
pushed through a little flatter, and Watson pats it back down the track
an even quicker one from Botha, but it's short outside off and Watson collects a single with a cut out into the deep
Ponting lunges forward to defend an offspinner that lands a little outside off
Ponting shifted forward and then back before nudging to square leg, straight to the fielder
worked with the spin down to fine leg, where the fielder runs across to keep them to one
Kallis is just short of a good length to start, Ponting hopping to defend to point
even though Ponting's picked up a single to mid on here, this is a much better, fuller length from Kallis. He found a touch of seam movement in off the pitch too
Watson guides an outswinger through gully for one
definite shape away from the bat once again from Kallis, and Ponting fetches it from outside off to pick up a single on the leg side
fired down full at middle, Watson leaning forward into a solid defence
where did that come from? Watson picks up the length delivery with a massive hoick into the leg side ... but the ball plugs in the outfield and is easily stopped
a flighted delivery is eased down to long on for one
good fielding saves runs at a close square leg. The delivery was too short from Botha, and Watson rocked back to pull but the fielder was in just the right position to stop a powerful shot
a touch flatter from Botha, and Watson is happy to defend
driven hard back at the bowler ... who lets the ball slip through his fingers and gives away a single
nicely bowled by the offspinner, giving this one some loop and keeping the batsman defensive
Watson flicks his bat across his pads to work the ball to midwicket, but hits it straight to the fielder
Watson slashes at the outswinger ... but the ball falls short of Steyn at third man
tapped down tp third man in rather more orthodox fashion this time

chopped on! Kallis strikes, and Watson falls for 49. He was just trying to run this down to third man, but it seemed in to him, taking a thick inside edge and cannoning into the stumps. This could revive South Africa
Clarke feels his way into a front foot drive, but his shot is stopped by a diving du Plessis in the covers
shaping away outside off, and Clarke steps across to leave
a sharp bouncer from the evergreen Kallis to end the over, and Clarke whips his head quickly out of harm's way
what did this touch? Ponting may have got a bit of glove or bat on this sweep, and the ball went very fine down to the boundary on the leg side
angled to short third man, where the fielder is quickly across to stop the single
there's another one! A soft dismissal for Ponting. Botha floated one down on off stump and Ponting just popped it straight back into his waiting hands. South Africa are right back into this now
Marsh offers careful defence
and now he's off the mark with a tap into the covers
nicely bowled by Botha, landing an offspinner on a good length outside off. Clarke defends with the turn into the leg side
overthrows! It was driven hard at Amla who had a shy at the non-striker's end. Unfortunately, Kallis wasn't backing up
off the inside edge! Clarke had pressed forward in defence, but it seamed in to him
good, probing stuff from Morkel, who attacks the stumps with a good length delivery that keeps Marsh defensive
slanted across the left-hander, who leaves alone. It looked like this one bounced a little more than Marsh might've been expecting.
a toe-ended drive rolls gently into the covers
and now this one keeps low! Marsh jabs the bat down in time, however, and finds a single to fine leg
just short of slip! This gripped and turned off the surface, taking the edge of Marsh's forward poke ... but dropping short of slip
popped uppishly back down the track now. Suddenly things don't like quite so easy for the batsmen
flicked off the pads for a single into the leg side
much quicker from Botha, and Clarke's clip to leg is stopped at midwicket
Clarke presses forward to a flighted delivery this time, defending to point
an appeal from the bowler! It was for lbw, but Clarke was struck outside the line of off
banged in just short of a good length, Marsh leaving well alone
off the thigh pad, and down to fine leg for four. Poor line from Morne
a rising delivery outside off is left well alone from Marsh, who whips the bat behind the body
defended solidly to cover point off the front foot
another leave from Marsh as Morkel continues to plug away outside off

Morkel was so confident in this lbw appeal, he almost didn't even turn around to face the umpire as he ran down the wicket in celebration. The ball kept a little low, off that length, but still would've missed the stumps
Clarke shimmies down the track but can't get to the pitch, defending
nudged into the leg side, and stopped at midwicket
beaten on the cut! The shot was on as the ball was quite wide, but the ball just skidded past the bat
again Clarke uses his feet, but again he finds the man at midwicket
watchful defence once again
and more defence from Clarke to end a maiden over
ouch! This spat off the pitch, tennis ball bounce really, and struck a fending Marsh on the chest
worked into the leg side for a quick single
Morkel strays into Clarke's pads, but the punishment is not severe as the shot is stopped at deep backward square
hammered in the air through point! Marsh came forward to drive and committed totally to the shot, hitting the ball with fierce power past a diving Kallis at point. It was in the air though
tapped gently into the leg side for a single
smell that! Morkel fires a bouncer past a hopping Clarke's grille
worked off the pads into the square-leg area
back of a length and Clarke defends to mid-on
stays deep in the crease and plays to leg
dragged down short on leg stump and that's easily put away by Clarke by a nice swivel-pull
back on off stump at a full length and crisply driven to mid-off
shorter and at the body but Clarke plays it comfortably to square leg

that's a lovely shot, short of a length outside off and Clarke uses his height by getting on his toes then punches it square through the off side. Steyn runs around from third man but drags the ball into the ropes
follows that with a meaty flow over mid-on, he took a good stride into the shot and lofted it clear of the in-field
full on off stump, driven nicely to mid-off
outside off and left alone
good delivery, back of a length and it jags away from Clarke's outside then goes even further as it carried to Boucher
comes half forward and pushes into the gap at midwicket...good over for Australia
full on off stump, Clarke comes forward and pushes to cover
short of a length and defended to the off side from the back foot
short again and it doesn't quite come on to Clarke's bat as he defends
top shot as Clarke leans into a full delivery on off stump and threads it between cover and mid-off
loose this time, Tsotsobe put some extra into this and it bounces more outside off stump to beat Clarke's cut shot
great response from the Australia captain as he gets a short delivery and pulls it strongly out to deep square leg
and beats the outside edge straight away with one slanted across Marsh which the batsman pushes at
nicely late-cut down to third man
full on middle and defended back down the pitch
outside off and left alone
tucked away off middle stump out to deep midwicket
goes back towards his stumps and tucks this to the leg side then almost slips as he sets off for a run
round the wicket, full at leg stump and work up to long on
outside off stump, Clarke plays forward and gets an inside edge to the leg side
quicker ball at the stumps, tucked to square leg where there's a fumble to allow the single
on off stump, defended with bat and pad together
touch shorter and it's played square off the back foot
lovely bowling but it costs four. It was a touch quicker and found the edge as Marsh played away from his body but flew wide of slip down to third man
first ball! What a start for Duminy. Round the wicket, full on the stumps, Clarke goes for a drive and gets an inside edge into his pads which then cannons into the stumps
full on middle and off, defended softly
beaten! Hussey goes back and tries to cut but the ball skids through
full on the pads but doesn't get past midwicket
tossed up but pushed down the leg side, good take by Boucher
flicked out to midwicket and it's well fielded
full delivery t end the work and it's driven to long off
round the wicket and pushed in at Hussey's feet
down the leg side and it's swept to deep square
takes a big stride forward and defends
held this back a fraction, Marsh comes forward again and gets an inside edge to the leg side
shorter which allows Marsh to work it off the back foot into the leg side
driven out to cover
full at leg stump and worked to midwicket
edged but short! Another one doesn't carry to Kallis at slip. Is he too deep? It was a decent edge but dipped in front of the fielder
dragged down short and cut through the off side
low full toss on leg stump and it's flicked to deep square
leg-stump line again and that's quite easy for Hussey as he works through the leg side
more turn and it beats the edge as Marsh plays forward. Lovely bowling.
goes deep in his crease then pushes off the back foot to cover
quicker and flatter, Hussey is still hanging back a touch as he plays to the off side
now he comes well forward and flicks this off leg stump through fine leg
full outside off, Marsh leans into a drive which finds the cover sweeper
full on middle, pushed into the off side
dabbed away off the pads to square leg
ooh, big full toss but gets away with as Hussey flicks straight to midwicket
the bowler will think he should have stopped that as Hussey drives firmly down the ground
decides to play back and has to come down on the ball fairly sharpish as it skids on
pushed down the leg side
he's playing firmly from his crease and defends this to the off side
half an appeal as this takes the pad but it's going down the leg side
can't connect with this as it drifts towards the pads and that's another tight over
Hussey presses forward to defend back to the bowler
driven down to long off for an easy single
looped down a little slower and wider outside off, and Marsh leaves alone. He's done that quite a bit tonight
the quicker one is tapped into the leg side
great stop by Miller at extra cover! The ball was driven hard to his right, and he leapt across the turf to stop it
and reasonably solid defence to end the over
turned off the toes, the ball rolling behind square on the leg side
Duminy offers width, and Marsh cuts out to deep point for a single
floated down full and straight by Duminy, Hussey defending
eased down to long off for a single
tapped back to the bowler, Duminy continuing to keep things tight
well, just as I write that he offers up a long hop outside off, but it's only two as Smith scoots round the cover boundary to cut it off
Hussey offers high-elbowed defence to a flighted offspinner
slightly less flight on this one, but Hussey's defence is just as solid
nudged into a gap at square leg, the call for a single comes quickly
Marsh stays deep in his crease and punches firmly to cover
looped up a little slower, and Marsh pushes to cover once more
off the inside half of the bat and down to fine leg
his line is good to start, an offcutter zipping past the outside edge of Marsh's bat
full and straight from Steyn. He holds the ball cross-seam, and it pops up at the batsman off the surface
short and wide outside off, and Marsh's cut flies wide of third man ... but not quite wide enough to reach the boundary. Good effort from Morkel saves a run
a touch short again from Steyn, and now it's Hussey cutting, but his shot is intercepted at point
another slower cutter, but it's picked by Hussey, who dabs it fine down to third man
slanted slightly wider across the batsman, who leaves the ball alone

bowled him! Duminy strikes straight after the interval. Duminy arrowed one down at middle, Marsh gave himself some room but the ball rushed straight on and clattered into middle stump. Just 67 needed by Australia, this is going to get tight
Duminy comes round the wicket to Haddin, with a slip in place, and the batsman defends a flighted offspinner
pushed to mid off with no great intent
tapped back down the track to the bowler
Haddin stretches outin defence once more
this time the batsman spots a bit of width, but his late cut goes straight to short third man
a slashed cut bounces down to third man, and Hussey hurries back for the second
well, it's the slower one this time from Steyn, but the shot is very similar and again they sprint through for a second
pushed to point off the front foot, no run this time
Hussey is targeting that point area. This time it's with a slap off the front foot, but Duminy is in the right position to stop it
a touch short, and Hussey swivels back in a flash and heaves a pull out to deep midwicket
speared down the leg side, and that's called wide
much better from Steyn, who hits a good length on off stump to keep Haddin defensive
Hussey finds enough of a gap between mid on and midwicket for a scampered single
Haddin is beaten on the drive! The shot was on, to a full, wide ball, but he couldn't lay bat on ball
Morkel keeps Haddin crease-bound with a rising length delivery on off stump
finally Haddin's off the mark! But not in the most convincing fashion. He backs away and hacks one back down the wicket, placing it straight enough for a single
Morkel hits a Test match length just outside off, and Hussey responds in Test match fashion, leaving alone
Hussey takes a tip-and-run single just in front of midwicket to end the over
good wheels from Steyn, who slings one down on a length to have Hussey defending to cover point
this would've been mighty close if he'd hit! Hussey tapped to du Plessis' right at cover and set off, Haddin scampered across but he would, in fact, had been out if du Plessis' shy had hit
a yorker outside off is dug out to Amla at mid off, and they find enough time for a single
clipped neatly off the pads, and an easy single is on offer to deep midwicket
bouncer from Steyn! Haddin is in no real trouble, however, swivelling out of the way

what an effort from the bowler! The ball took the toe end of the bat and bounced up off the pad. Steyn changed direction in his follow through and charged across the wicket in a valiant attempt to take the caught-and-bowled chance, but couldn't quite get to it
a touch short outside off, but Hussey can only chop it to point
this is a better length from Morkel, and again Hussey can't beat backward point as he tries to run it down
good effort from a diving du Plessis at extra cover, but he palms the drive to long off and so they still take a single
great delivery from Morkel, in the channel outside off. Haddin is neither forward nor back as he defends to point
that's one way to break the shackles! Haddin makes room and slams the ball straight back over Morkel's head. Where did that come from?
Morkel responds with a shorter one that zips past Haddin's attempted pull
he finds some shape away from the left hander, but Hussey uses the width to run the ball down to third man
a slower cutter from Tsotsobe, and Haddin pops it into the leg side for a single
another offcutter from Tsotsobe, and this one jabs in appreciably off the pitch, cramping Hussey's attempted dab to third man
Hussey presses half forward to defend a delivery that's aimed at the off stump
something of a bouncer from the bowler, and Hussey cracks a pull out into the deep
Haddin finds the boundary again! Too short, too wide, and his cut had the beating of Morkel down at third man
round the wicket, full outside off stump and driven to deep cover
stays round the wicket, on leg stump and turned to midwicket
top shot! Haddin playing well here as he comes down the pitch and outside leg stump which opens up the off side then he lofts over mid-off
now he targets the leg side, picks this up from outside off over deep square-leg and clears the rope. Momentum swings again
fired in full and pushed back to the bowler
flatter on off stump, Haddin defends but he'd already had plenty off that over
on off stump and pushed into the off side
nearly! banged in short, Hussey goes for the pull and it comes off the splice which loops square on the leg side but away from any fielders
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
good bouncer, and it's hit Haddin. It was actually the lack of pace that did for him as he was early on the shot and got a bottom edge into his stomach
time for another twist?! Haddin couldn't restrain himself. He stood on leg stump and tried to clear the off side but picked out deep cover
back of a length on off stump, driven square into the off side that'll please Australia that he keeps the strike
on leg stump, swept away with great contact
worked down the ground to long on...perhaps should have had the man in the ring
big turn! Hussey is beaten by a lovely delivery outside off as it spins away and he drives
flighted on middle, Hussey comes forward and defends
he gets this through cover with a powerful drive but the fielder was de Plessis who'll think he could have stopped it
squeezed out into the leg side off a thick inside edge which rolls to short fine leg and he has the strike again
driven firmly to mid-off but they scamper another single...he's ticking them off
on middle and leg, calmly played through square leg...South Africa need to string some deliveries together at Johnson
that helps for Australia, it was a short ball which Hussey went to pull and it came off a top edge that flew very fine
short of a length outside off and he opens the face down to third man
another bouncer and he sails over leg stump...it's too leg-side for the umpires
short outside off but Johnson isn't able to connect cleanly with his pull which rolls to mid-on
almost the game now as Johnson drives a delivery hard into the pitch then it scoots straight down the ground
typical of Hussey as he angles this down to third man
play and miss and Johnson goes for cut...no need for any heroics from Mitch
full on middle and played back to the bowler
comes onto the front foot and plays to backward point
gone! This game refuses to die. Johnson chases a length ball outside off and gets an edge which carries low to Boucher. It was a good catch.
comes forward and plays carefully into the off side
outside off and left alone
back of a length and he guides it down to third man so no issues about exposing Cummins
full at the stumps and played to midwicket
beaten! Feels for this outside off then tries to pull his bat inside the line
extra bounce and he gets behind the line then the ball loops of the pad to square leg
he can't get the single as he drives a length delivery to cover
neatly played as he flicks it off his pads but picks out midwicket
so close! Kallis went short and Cummins responded with a pull which looped off the top edge over keeper and Smith at slip
fuller on off stump, he lunges forward and pushes towards mid-on
well played! Outside off stump and he finds a gap through point with a square drive that beats third man
comes forward and plays square into the off again but this time doesn't find a gap
excellent yorker and equally well dug out by Cummins
full on middle and off, driven firmly straight to mid-off who is now in very tight
can't find the gap again as he drives to cover
Australia take the match and the series! Hussey does it in fine style as he hammers away a short ball to midwicket
